 \newcommand\makebeamertitle{\frame{\maketitle}}%
 \AtBeginDocument{
   \let\origtableofcontents=\tableofcontents
   \def\tableofcontents{\@ifnextchar[{\origtableofcontents}{\gobbletableofcontents}}
   \def\gobbletableofcontents#1{\origtableofcontents}
 }
 \long\def\lyxframe#1{\@lyxframe#1\@lyxframestop}%
 \def\@lyxframe{\@ifnextchar<{\@@lyxframe}{\@@lyxframe<*>}}%
 \def\@@lyxframe<#1>{\@ifnextchar[{\@@@lyxframe<#1>}{\@@@lyxframe<#1>[]}}
 \def\@@@lyxframe<#1>[{\@ifnextchar<{\@@@@@lyxframe<#1>[}{\@@@@lyxframe<#1>[<*>][}}
 \def\@@@@@lyxframe<#1>[#2]{\@ifnextchar[{\@@@@lyxframe<#1>[#2]}{\@@@@lyxframe<#1>[#2][]}}
 \long\def\@@@@lyxframe<#1>[#2][#3]#4\@lyxframestop#5\lyxframeend{%
   \frame<#1>[#2][#3]{\frametitle{#4}#5}}
 \def\lyxframeend{} % In case there is a superfluous frame end

\usepackage{babel}

\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}

\title{Algorithms for prebisimilarity}


\subtitle{B Tech Project, 2012-13}


\author{Mihir Mehta\inst{1} }


\institute{\inst{1}Department of Computer Science\\
 Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi\\
 }

\makebeamertitle

\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Motivation}
\begin{itemize}
\item To create a software toolkit that is useful to anyone working with
verification on timed automata. 
\item To incorporate therein the recent advances using pre-ordering approaches
(specifically, prebisimilarity.) 
\end{itemize}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Topics from previous presentations}
\begin{itemize}
\item CCS and Labeled Transition Systems. 
\item Strong and weak bisimilarity on CCS, relevant algorithms (Kanellakis-Smolka,
Fernandez). 
\item Timed automata. 
\item Timed and untimed bisimilarity on timed automata. 
\item Region graphs. 
\item Zone graphs. 
\item Code: Fernandez' algorithm, parsing timed automata. 
\end{itemize}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Progress since last presentation}
\begin{itemize}
\item Ocaml interface for UPPAAL DBM libraries. 
\item Generation of zone graphs. 
\item Untimed bisimilarity on zone graphs -> zone-valuation graphs. 
\item Generation of visual graphs depicting these relations. 
\end{itemize}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Theoretical context}
\begin{itemize}
\item Zone graphs offer a discrete abstraction over the continuous state
space for TA. 
\item A state in a zone graph is always associated with a convex polyhedron
in the time space. 
\item Zone-valuation graphs have the additional property of being minimal. 
\item Our implementation uses untimed bisimilarity (Fernandez' algorithm)
for this minimisation. 
\end{itemize}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Future work}

In order of increasing immediacy: 
\begin{enumerate}
\item Refine the implementation of zone-valuation graphs using abstractions.
\cite{Tripakis1998} 
\item Use the zone-valuation graph to implement timed performance prebisimilarity
checking. \cite{SAK2012} 
\item Implement time-abstracted bisimilarity relations using region graphs.\cite{Tripakis2001} 
\item Package up the tool for distribution. 
\end{enumerate}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{References}
\begin{thebibliography}{1}
\bibitem{SAK2012}S. Guha, C. Narayan, and S. Arun-Kumar. \newblock\emph{On
Decidability of Prebisimulation for Timed Automata}.\newblock 24th
International Conference, CAV 2012, Berkeley, CA, USA, July 7-13,
2012 Proceedings.

\bibitem{Tripakis2001}S. Tripakis, S. Yovine.\newblock \emph{Analysis
of Timed Systems Using Time-Abstracting Bisimulations.} \newblockFormal
Methods in System Design Volume 18, Issue 1 , pp 25-68

\bibitem{Tripakis1998}C. Daws and S. Tripakis. \newblock Model checking
of real-time reachability properties using abstractions. \newblock
Tools and Algorithms for the Construction and Analysis of Systems
'98, Lisbon, Portugal. LNCS, Vol. 1384, Springer- Verlag, 1998.\end{thebibliography}

\end{document}
